topic: Essential Vocabulary: Family, Colors, and Days of the Week
detailedSummary: Building vocabulary is essential for communication. Family vocabulary includes: padre/papá (father), madre/mamá (mother), hijo (son), hija (daughter), hermano (brother), hermana (sister), abuelo (grandfather), abuela (grandmother), tío (uncle), tía (aunt), primo (cousin, male), prima (cousin, female), esposo/marido (husband), esposa/mujer (wife). Colors are adjectives that agree with nouns: rojo (red), azul (blue), verde (green), amarillo (yellow), negro (black), blanco (white), gris (gray), marrón/café (brown), rosa (pink), naranja (orange), morado (purple). Days of the week: lunes (Monday), martes (Tuesday), miércoles (Wednesday), jueves (Thursday), viernes (Friday), sábado (Saturday), domingo (Sunday). Note: days are not capitalized in Spanish. Months: enero, febrero, marzo, abril, mayo, junio, julio, agosto, septiembre, octubre, noviembre, diciembre. Seasons: primavera (spring), verano (summer), otoño (fall), invierno (winter). These vocabulary sets are used constantly in daily conversation and are essential building blocks.
whyItMatters: Family, colors, and time vocabulary are used constantly in daily conversation - mastering these essential words enables you to describe people, objects, and discuss schedules and relationships.

assignments.title: Build Essential Spanish Vocabulary
assignments.description: Learn and practice essential vocabulary for family, colors, and time expressions.
tasks: Create a family tree in Spanish, labeling all family members
Describe objects in your room using color vocabulary with correct gender agreement
Write your weekly schedule using days of the week and times
Create flashcards for all vocabulary and practice pronunciation
Write a paragraph describing your family using the vocabulary learned

quizzes.question: How do you say 'sister' in Spanish?
quizzes.explanation: 'Hermana' means sister. 'Hermano' is brother, 'hijo' is son, and 'hija' is daughter.

quizzes.question: Days of the week in Spanish are capitalized like in English.
quizzes.explanation: False. Days of the week and months are not capitalized in Spanish (e.g., 'lunes', not 'Lunes').

quizzes.question: How do you say 'Wednesday' in Spanish?
quizzes.explanation: 'Miércoles' is Wednesday. The days are: lunes, martes, miércoles, jueves, viernes, sábado, domingo.
